on someone's doorstep
[ T often passive ] disapproving If you are doorstepped by journalists, they come to your house and ask you to speak or answer questions, even if you do not want them to: He complained about being doorstepped by the press.
[ I or T ] to go to every house in a particular area selling something or asking for support
